comments:
This exception occurs when I run the ATL plugin. The class not found is in the AM3 plugin top level Am3Tools.jar and referenced by the plugin META-INF\MANIFEST.MF Bundle-Activator: org.eclipse.gmt.am3.tools.ant.AntPlugin. Stack trace:

org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The activator org.eclipse.gmt.am3.tools.ant.AntPlugin for bundle org.eclipse.gmt.am3.tools.ant is invalid
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.loadBundleActivator(AbstractBundle.java:141)
........
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.build(Workspace.java:271)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.GlobalBuildAction$1.run(GlobalBuildAction.java:183)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.gmt.am3.tools.ant.AntPlugin
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:402)
Did you managed to solve your issue?
